content:
A mixture of H3PW12O40·24H2O (0.300 g, 0.09 mmol), Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.080 g, 0.33 mmol), L (0.032 g, 0.11 mmol) and H2O (8 mL) was stirred for half an hour at room temperature. Then, the pH was adjusted to 6.8 with 1.0 mol L−1 NaOH. The mixture was transferred to a Teflon-lined autoclave and kept at 120° C for 3 days. After slow cooling to room temperature, purple block crystals of 1 were obtained (yield: ca. 35% based on Cu). Elemental analysis (%) found for C64H104Cu2N16O68PW12: C 16.8, H 2.3, N 5.0%. Calcd: C 16.8, H 2.3, N 4.9%. IR (KBr, cm−1): 3,433(s), 1,624(s), 1,544(w), 1,471(m), 1,438(m), 1,265(m), 1,166(w), 1,101(m), 1,056(s), 1,006(m), 950(s), 877(s), 815(s), 732(m).

Preparation of compound <bold>1</bold> bulk-modified carbon paste electrode (<bold>1</bold>-CPE)

The 1-CPE was fabricated as follows: 0.5 g graphite powder and 0.032 g compound 1 were mixed and ground together by agate mortar and pestle for about half an hour, and then 0.20 mL paraffin oil was added and stirred with a glass rod. The homogenized mixture was used to pack 3 mm inner diameter glass tubes to a length of 0.8 cm. The electrical contact was established with the copper stick, and the surface of the 1-CPE was polished by weighing paper.
clean_text:
Synthesis of {[Cu2(L)4(H2O)4](PW11VIWVO40)}⋅16H2O (1)

A mixture of H3PW12O40⋅24H2O (0.300 g, 0.09 mmol), Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (0.080 g, 0.33 mmol), L (0.032 g, 0.11 mmol) and H2O (8 mL) was stirred for half an hour at room temperature. Then, the pH was adjusted to 6.8 with 1.0 mol L-1 NaOH. The mixture was transferred to a Teflon-lined autoclave and kept at 120° C for 3 days. After slow cooling to room temperature, purple block crystals of 1 were obtained (yield: ca. 35% based on Cu). Elemental analysis (%) found for C64H104Cu2N16O68PW12: C 16.8, H 2.3, N 5.0%. Calcd: C 16.8, H 2.3, N 4.9%. IR (KBr, cm-1): 3,433(s), 1,624(s), 1,544(w), 1,471(m), 1,438(m), 1,265(m), 1,166(w), 1,101(m), 1,056(s), 1,006(m), 950(s), 877(s), 815(s), 732(m).

Preparation of compound 1 bulk-modified carbon paste electrode (1-CPE)

The 1-CPE was fabricated as follows: 0.5 g graphite powder and 0.032 g compound 1 were mixed and ground together by agate mortar and pestle for about half an hour, and then 0.20 mL paraffin oil was added and stirred with a glass rod. The homogenized mixture was used to pack 3 mm inner diameter glass tubes to a length of 0.8 cm. The electrical contact was established with the copper stick, and the surface of the 1-CPE was polished by weighing paper.
